intro: Spergula pissisi, commonly known as the Ethiopian spoonworts, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine environments. Spergula pissisi is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
